result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon D May was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Devon D May is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Devon D May was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered that ONLY THE MANDATORY costs, fees, and assessments due on or before 9/11/16. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 5 days TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon D May

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

 COURT ORDERED THE  Defendant to serve 5 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5 DAYS TIME SERVED.  Court ordered that ONLY THE MANDATORY costs, fees, and assessments due on or before 09-11-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form received and filed with court.

Defendant Devon D May in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Devon D May not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. Court pre-approved transfer to branch 40 for global resolution on this case, if accepted. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing date in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Devon D May not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing date.   Neither party requests to address the court on the record.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devon D May in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Devon D May in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Effective JUNE 8, 2015 this case will be assigned to RESERVED BRANCH 45.  Scheduling Conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 8:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for calendar call.   The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The court does not forfeit any bail at this time.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant failing to appear.  Statements by defense that defendant has pending cases before Branch 40 scheduled for 4-23-2015.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 04-23-2015.  Calendar call scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JUSTICEPOINT VIOLATION REPORT SUBMITTED AND FILED - Missed Office Contact. jks
JUSTICEPOINT VIOLATION REPORT SUBMITTED AND FILED - Missed Office Report. jks

Defendant Devon D May in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Court in receipt of violation report.  Court admonished defendant regarding his use of THC and advised him that any further positive tests will result in higher cash bail.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Devon D May not in court, in custody, Not produced.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has a pending felony in Branch 40.  Defense requests 6-8 weeks in hopes that case will be settled.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devon D May in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Devon D May in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
